oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wound management in cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mulon, Pierre-Yves
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: wound
cattle
primary intention healing
secondary intention healing
infection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wounds of variable shapes, lengths, locations, depths and ages are invariably encountered by bovine practitioners. The heal足ing process starts immediately following the insult and is com足posed of 3 overlapping phases: inflammatory, proliferative and remodeling. Each of these phases can be subdivided into more specific steps during which biochemical and cellular events oc足cur, ultimately resulting in the restauration of a physical barri足er protecting the deeper structures. Whether the completion of the healing process allows to return to a full function depends on multiple factors, including the type of wounds, the location of the wound, and the structures involved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2021 Annual Conference Proceedings; 209-210
